titles.title: Options for Investors through United States Certified Coins Act of 2005
Options for Investors through United States Certified Coins Act of 2005

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow certain coins to be acquired by individual retirement accounts and other individually directed pension plan accounts, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: Options for Investors through United States Certified Coins Act of 2005 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to permit holders of individual retirement accounts or individually-directed pension plans to invest in coins which: (1) are certified by an independent, third-party grading service; (2) are, or were at any time, legal tender in the United States; and (3) are traded on a nationally recognized electronic coin trading network or listed by an independent coin wholesale reporting service.
